content:
@Dimitri Szabo hi! I was just reading through #10747 and I was wondering if you've considered using the Search API.

You can filter by type within a collection like this: https://entrepot.recherche.data.gouv.fr/api/search?q=*&type=dataset&subtree=amap

Hi! Thanks for the suggestion! Yes, but the issue with the search API is to get the evolution in the past.
Of course its doable with publication dates but not ideal, as the other solution of fetching and subtracting the results for the sub-collections with the Metrics one :)

Get the evolution of the past? I'm confused. Does https://entrepot.recherche.data.gouv.fr/api/dataverses/amap/contents give you this? The data is pretty sparse: {"type":"dataverse","id":8724,"title":"AMAP ECOSFIX"}, etc.

Sorry, I mixed up my issues :sweat_smile:!
You are absolutely right, it does give the same output that a filtered contents would
No worries. I'm glad the Search API is helping.
